required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate Frozen Versus Refrigerated MMRV (Combined Measles, Mumps, Rubella, and Varicella) Investigational Vaccine (V221-016)
clinical_study.official_title: A Comparison of the Safety, Tolerability, and Immunogenicity of a Refrigerator-Stable Measles, Mumps, Rubella, and Varicella Combination Vaccine V221 (Refrigerated) Versus V221 (Frozen) in Healthy Children

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to demonstrate that an investigational refrigerated vaccine with measles, mumps, rubella, and varicella is well tolerated and has similar immune response when compared to a frozen vaccine with measles, mumps, rubella, and varicella.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent of patients demonstrating adequate antibody titers 6 weeks following administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Geometric mean titers (GMT) 6 weeks post vaccination

intervention.intervention_name: V221, measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (Oka/Merck) virus vaccine live / Duration of Treatment: 12 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy children 12-23 months of age
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previously had measles, mumps, rubella, or varicella
- Compromised immune system

results_reference.citation: Bernstein HH, Eves K, Campbell K, Black SB, Twiggs JD, Reisinger KS, Conti RM, Flodmark CE, Rombo L, Klopfer S, Sch√∂del F, Hartzel J, Kuter BJ; Refrigerator-Stable Formulation Study Group for ProQuad. Comparison of the safety and immunogenicity of a refrigerator-stable versus a frozen formulation of ProQuad (measles, mumps, rubella, and varicella virus vaccine live). Pediatrics. 2007 Jun;119(6):e1299-305. Epub 2007 May 14.
